Items.Title: Roll Call
Invocation
Items.AgendaNote:
Delivered by: Rev. Daryl G. Bloodsaw, Pastor First Baptist Church of Crown Heights, 450 Eastern Parkway, Brooklyn, N.Y. 11225.

Motion to spread the invocation in full upon the record by Council Member Cumbo.
Items.MinutesNote:
The Invocation was delivered by: Rev. Daryl G. Bloodsaw, Pastor First Baptist Church of Crown Heights, 450 Estern Parkway, Broklyn, N.Y. 11225.



Council Member Cumbo moved to spread the Invocation in full upon the Record.

Items.Title: Adoption of Minutes
Items.AgendaNote: Motion that the Minutes of the Stated Meetings of September 17, 2015 be adopted as printed by Council Member Lander.
Items.MinutesNote: Council Member Lander moved that the Minutes of the Stated Meeting of September 17, 2015 be adopted as printed.

Items.Title: Messages & Papers from the Mayor

Land Use Call-Ups

By Council Member Rose:
Pursuant to Rule 11.20.b of the Council and Section 197-d (b)(3) of the New York City Charter, the Council hereby resolves that the action of the City Planning Commission on Uniform Land Use Review Procedure Application No. C 150447 ZSR shall be subject to Council review.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Land Use Call-Up be Approved, by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Zoning, Parcel 1 of the North Waterfront Subdistrict, Staten Island (C 150447 ZSR)

Introduction & Reading of Bills
See Attached
Discussion of Resolutions
Resolutions

INTRODUCTION AND READING OF BILLS

A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring the police department to report on domestic violence and hate crime statistics, and to repeal section 3-112 of the administrative code of the city of New York, relating to requiring the mayor’s office of operations to report on domestic violence and hate crime statistics.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Public Safety
Items.MatterName: Requiring the police department and mayor's office to report on domestic violence and hate crime statistics.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring the Administration for Children’s Services to report on programs and services provided to youth in placement and detention facilities
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on General Welfare
Items.MatterName: Requiring the Administration for Children’s Services to report on programs and services provided to youth in placement and detention facilities

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to limiting the number of sightseeing bus licenses.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Consumer Affairs
Items.MatterName: Limiting the number of sightseeing bus licenses.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring direct telephone access to 911 service
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Technology
Items.MatterName: Requiring direct telephone access to 911 service.

Items.Title: Resolution calling on the New York State Legislature to pass, and the Governor to sign, legislation that would require institutions of higher education to provide survivors of sexual assaults that occur on campus with resources and assistance on obtaining information regarding their legal rights.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Higher Education
Items.MatterName: Require institutions of higher education to provide survivors of sexual assaults that occur on campus with resources and assistance on obtaining information regarding their legal rights.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring the department of education to report information regarding health education.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Education
Items.MatterName: Requiring DOE to report information regarding health education.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to notice of permanent parking restriction changes.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Transportation
Items.MatterName: Notice of permanent parking restriction changes.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring the department of transportation to provide notice of proposed bus route changes
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Transportation
Items.MatterName: Requiring DOT to provide notice of proposed bus route changes.

Items.Title: Resolution approving the new designation and changes in the designation of certain organizations to receive funding in the Expense Budget
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Finance
Items.MatterName: Approving the new designation and changes in the designation of certain organizations to receive funding in the Expense Budget.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to civil penalties for street construction, maintenance, repair, obstruction, and closure violations
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Transportation
Items.MatterName: Civil penalties for street construction, maintenance, repair, obstruction, and closure violations.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to extending the biotechnology credit against the unincorporated business tax and the general corporation tax
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Finance
Items.MatterName: Extending the biotechnology credit against the unincorporated business tax and the general corporation tax.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring transparency from the department of education on instructors receiving training in sexual health education.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Education
Items.MatterName: Requiring transparency from the department of education on instructors receiving training in sexual health education.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to client satisfaction surveys for city-funded indigent legal services
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Courts and Legal Services
Items.MatterName: Client satisfaction surveys for city-funded indigent legal services.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring the police department to report on hate crime statistics
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Public Safety
Items.MatterName: Requiring the police department to report on hate crime statistics.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Legislature to pass legislation requiring all New York City charter schools to reserve 5% of their seats for late-enrolling “over the counter” students.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Education
Items.MatterName: Requiring all NYC charter schools to reserve 5% of their seats for late-enrolling “over the counter” students.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the New York city administrative code, in relation to creating a safe construction bill of rights
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Housing and Buildings
Items.MatterName: Creating a Safe Construction Bill of Rights.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring the police department to report on intimate partner domestic violence statistics
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Public Safety
Items.MatterName: Requiring the police department to report on intimate partner domestic violence statistics.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to reducing city government emission of greenhouse gases by 40 percent by 2030
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Environmental Protection
Items.MatterName: Reducing city government emission of greenhouse gases by 40 percent by 2030.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Legislature to pass and the Governor to sign legislation that would establish a state carbon tax.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Environmental Protection
Items.MatterName: Establish a state carbon tax.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the City University of New York to divest from fossil fuel company investments and reinvest those funds in renewable energy, sustainability, and social-minded companies.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Higher Education
Items.MatterName: CUNY to divest from fossil fuel company investments and reinvest those funds in renewable energy, sustainability, and social-minded companies.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the Governor to sign S.2905/A.2177-A and S.4279/A.5508, which would establish tax incentives for the sale, purchase and installation of geothermal energy systems in New York
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Environmental Protection
Items.MatterName: Establish tax incentives for the sale, purchase and installation of geothermal energy systems in NY (S.2905/A.2177-A)

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to a citywide transit study
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Transportation
Items.MatterName: Citywide transit study.

Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Transportation
Items.MatterName: A study to be conducted by the DOT determining the feasibility of building a light rail system in the city of NY.

Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Transportation
Items.MatterName: Allowing purchases of street parking time to be made via mobile application or text message.

Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Transportation
Items.MatterName: Create a task force to study taxicab medallion values.

Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Housing and Buildings
Items.MatterName: Construction conditions in housing development projects.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring the police department to report on domestic violence crime statistics in public housing
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Public Safety

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York City Department of Education to implement a uniform curriculum on healthy relationships for the purpose of domestic violence prevention in all schools.

Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Small Business

Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Technology
Items.MatterName: Biannual report on the activities of the technology steering committee.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the United States Congress to pass and the President to sign S.713/H.R. 1340, also known as the International Violence Against Women Act of 2015.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Women's Issues
Items.MatterName: International Violence Against Women Act of 2015. (S.713/H.R. 1340)

There were 44 Council Members present at this Stated Meeting.

Items.MinutesNote: At this point the Speaker (Council Member Mark-Viverito) made the following annoucements:

Whereupon on motion of the Speaker (Council Member Mark-Viverito), the Public Advocate (Ms. James) adjourned to meet again on Wednesday, October 28, 2015.

MICHAEL McSWEENEY, City Clerk

Clerk of the Council
